conclusion: Understanding the relationship between velocity, acceleration, and displacement in the graph.
Graph shows square of velocity on y-axis and displacement on x-axis; slope represents a quantity related to acceleration.
Recalling the kinematic equation: v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
Since cars start from rest, u = 0, simplifying to v^2 = 2ax.
In the graph, slope of the line is 2a; steeper slope indicates higher acceleration.
Observing two lines in the graph: one for Car A and one for Car B.
Slope of Car A's line is steeper than Car B's line.
Steeper slope corresponds to higher value of 2a, hence higher acceleration.
Car A has a greater acceleration than Car B.
